Sentence: At a barbecue at the Wilkes plantation the next day, Scarlett confesses her (Ashley) feelings to Ashley

He (Scarlett) tells her (Ashley) that he (Scarlett) does love her (Ashley) but that he (Scarlett) is marrying Melanie because she (Ashley) is similar to him (Scarlett), whereas he (Scarlett) and Scarlett are very different
Scarlett slaps Ashley and he (Scarlett) leaves the room
Suddenly Scarlett realizes that she (Ashley) is not alone
She (Melanie) spitefully agrees to marry him (Scarlett), hoping to hurt Ashley
Over the course of two months, Scarlett and Charles marry, Charles joins the army and dies of the measles, and Scarlett learns that she (Ashley) is pregnant
After Scarlett gives birth to a son, Wade, she (Ashley) becomes bored and unhappy
Scarlett and Melanie fear for Ashley's safety
Scarlett desperately wants to return home to Tara, but she (Tara) has promised Ashley she (Ashley) will stay with the pregnant Melanie, who could give birth at any time
At last the war ends, word comes that Ashley is free and on his (Scarlett) way home, and a stream of returning soldiers begins pouring through Tara

Scarlett's feelings for Ashley have diminished into a warm, sympathetic friendship, but Ashley's jealous sister, India, finds them in a friendly embrace and spreads the rumor that they are having an affair
Melanie makes Scarlett promise to look after Ashley and Beau
Scarlett realizes that she (Ashley) loves and depends on Melanie and that Ashley has been only a fantasy for her (Ashley)
